items.sentence: It\'s likely to get cold tonight, so you may need an extra blanket.

It\'s not that I don\'t care, I just don\'t care as much as you do.
Tom should be more careful not to bother Mary while she\'s working.
Don\'t you think your French is good enough to explain the problem?
He can\'t swim at all, but when it comes to skiing, he is the best.
I bet we\'ve all asked ourselves that same question more than once.
Tom\'s father doesn\'t approve of him having long hair and a beard.
Tom\'s the last person I would\'ve expected to have a heart attack.
You haven\'t told Tom what we have planned for next week, have you?
You\'re supposed to have this poem memorized before our next class.
A lot more people died in Second World War than in First World War.
A stranger living nearby is better than a relative living far away.
An up-to-date edition of the encyclopedia will come out next month.
Apparently, Tom was late because there was a traffic jam on Rt. 19.
Generally speaking, women live longer than men by almost ten years.
Mary was a tomboy growing up and liked to repair cars and tractors.
My doctor told me to put the eyedrops in my eyes three times a day.
My father made my mother a cup of coffee just the way she likes it.
In 1955, the cancer returned and she died in 1956 at the age of 42.
It looks like I was right about Tom not showing up for the meeting.
It never occurred to me that Tom might feel that same way Mary did.
I\'d love to be able to find more time that I could spend relaxing.
It seems like I\'m the only one here who knows how to speak French.
You should probably tell Tom who\'ll be meeting him at the station.
You should tell Tom that you don\'t plan to be in Boston next week.

You\'d be amazed how long it takes Tom to get ready in the morning.
Frankly speaking, it\'s difficult to understand why you want to go.

If I could have spoken French better, I might have gotten that job.

I think that you and I should probably be able to get along better.
